questiontext.text:
An industry-leading company seeks a qualified candidate for a management position. A management consultancy carries out an assessment center which concludes in making a positive or negative recommendation for each candidate: From previous assessments they know that of those candidates that are actually eligible for the position (event EE) 66%66\% get a positive recommendation (event RR). However, out of those candidates that are not eligible 73%73\% get a negative recommendation. Overall, they know that only 13%13\% of all job applicants are actually eligible. ab\frac{a}{b}

What is the corresponding fourfold table of the joint probabilities? (Specify all entries in percent.)

RR R¯\overline{R} sum
EE {1:NUMERICAL:=8.58:0.05~%0%495366:0}% {1:NUMERICAL:=4.42:0.05~%0%495366:0}% {1:NUMERICAL:=13:0.05~%0%495366:0}%
E¯\overline{E} {1:NUMERICAL:=23.49:0.05~%0%495366:0}% {1:NUMERICAL:=63.51:0.05~%0%495366:0}% {1:NUMERICAL:=87:0.05~%0%495366:0}%
sum {1:NUMERICAL:=32.07:0.05~%0%495366:0}% {1:NUMERICAL:=67.93:0.05~%0%495366:0}% {1:NUMERICAL:=100:0.05~%0%495366:0}%

generalfeedback.text:
Using the information from the text, we can directly calculate the following joint probabilities: P(E∩R)=P(R|E)⋅P(E)=0.66⋅0.13=0.0858=8.58%P(E¯∩R¯)=P(R¯|E¯)⋅P(E¯)=0.73⋅0.87=0.6351=63.51%. \begin{aligned} P(E \cap R) & = P(R | E) \cdot P(E) = 0.66 \cdot 0.13 = 0.0858 = 8.58\%\\ P(\overline{E} \cap \overline{R}) & = P(\overline{R} | \overline{E}) \cdot P(\overline{E}) = 0.73 \cdot 0.87 = 0.6351 = 63.51\%. \end{aligned} The remaining probabilities can then be found by calculating sums and differences in the fourfold table:

RR R¯\overline{R} sum
EE 8.58 4.42 13.00
E¯\overline{E} 23.49 63.51 87.00
sum 32.07 67.93 100.00
  1. P(E∩R)=8.58%P(E \cap R) = 8.58\%
  2. P(E¯∩R)=23.49%P(\overline{E} \cap R) = 23.49\%
  3. P(E∩R¯)=4.42%P(E \cap \overline{R}) = 4.42\%
  4. P(E¯∩R¯)=63.51%P(\overline{E} \cap \overline{R}) = 63.51\%
  5. P(R)=32.07%P(R) = 32.07\%
  6. P(R¯)=67.93%P(\overline{R}) = 67.93\%
  7. P(E)=13.00%P(E) = 13.00\%
  8. P(E¯)=87.00%P(\overline{E}) = 87.00\%
  9. P(Ω)=100.00%P(\Omega) = 100.00\%
